title: Crystal Cruises launches three new brands
text:
Crystal Cruises launches three new brands 20 July 2015 Save 
Crystal Cruises is launching three new cruise brands, as well as a special air product using its own Boeing 787 Dreamliner fully configured for business-class travel. 
Making the announcement together, Crystal’s president and chief executive, Edie Rodriguez and chairman Tan Sri Lim Kok Thay said the first of the new cruise classes would take shape with the delivery of Crystal Esprit in November, 2015. 
The 62-passenger ship will embark on December 23 on its maiden voyage under the new all-inclusive Crystal Yacht Cruises brand, sailing regional itineraries of seven days in length with the inaugural cruise in Seychelles. 
Throughout 2016 and 2017, and early 2018, Crystal Esprit cruises will be offered for the Seychelles Islands, Dubai and Adriatic Coast. 
Meanwhile the launch of Crystal River Cruises will take place in 2017 before Crystal Exclusive Class launches in 2018 when the operator takes delivery of the first of three exclusive-class ships after Genting Hong Kong signed a letter of intent with Lloyd Werft in Germany. 
Crystal is also preparing to launch Crystal Luxury Air in 2017 when it takes delivery of a Dreamliner which will be configured to fly 60 customers. 
Itineraries will be roughly 28 days in length and will visit between 10 and 12 destinations with top accommodation and entertainment. 
Tan Sri Lim said: “Our intent is to make Crystal Cruises the core of what will become the world’s premier luxury hospitality and lifestyle brand portfolio, not only for the immediate future but for years to come.” 
Rodriguez added: “We continue to think bigger, aiming to create unparalleled luxury experiences and adventures for our loyal and new guests, who - like Crystal - continue to seek broader horizons and new perspectives on the world. 
“Our intent is to make Crystal Cruises the core of what will become the world’s premier luxury hospitality and lifestyle brand portfolio”Tan Sri Lim 
“We are ecstatic to continue pioneering new areas of luxury travel. Crystal’s newly expanded fleet will truly be travelers’ passport to virtually the entire world.” 
Tan Sri Lim said once the operator takes delivery of its exclusive class ships it will be able to offer luxury expedition-capable ships. 
Rodriguez added: “With an impressive 100 tons of space per guest, the average space ratio for luxury cruise ships being 60 tons per person, our new ships’ guest-to-space rations will be vast in comparison to past, current and under- construction luxury ships, reaching all corners of the world safely, smoothly and in the utmost style and comfort.”
